head.title: Valhalla Software Developer Acquires Israeli Company

hedline.hl1: Valhalla Software Developer Acquires Israeli Company

abstract.p: Cognet Corp of Valhalla, NY, acquires software producer myITcorp in stock purchase agreement valued at $7.5 million (S)

block.p: Cognet Corporation, a Valhalla-based developer of software management technologies for corporate computing and personal communications devices, has acquired the software producer myITcorp in a stock purchase agreement valued at $7.5 million.
MyITcorp, based in Haifa, Israel, is one of the leading providers of integrated policy management, usage and inventory software for corporations and government organizations.

Cognet Corporation, a Valhalla-based developer of software management technologies for corporate computing and personal communications devices, has acquired the software producer myITcorp in a stock purchase agreement valued at $7.5 million.
MyITcorp, based in Haifa, Israel, is one of the leading providers of integrated policy management, usage and inventory software for corporations and government organizations.
Under terms of the acquisition, Mark Hellinger, the chief executive of myITcorp, will be appointed to Cognet's board, joining Dov Goldman, Cognet's chairman and chief executive officer.
